line_1: For heaven-born Friendship can each scene endear.
line_2: Their conduct blameless, and their souls sincere,

line_1: But then — her voice! — how fram'd t' endear!
line_2: The music of the Gods to hear!

line_1: Such mutual kindnesses the Soul indear,
line_2: Exalis was your Joy, and you was all his Care.

line_1: While mutual wishes, mutual woes, endear
line_2: The social smile and sympathetic tear.
To labours hope shall never cheer,

line_1: " Her grief to me the mourner will endear:
line_2: " To screen from every harm be mine the care;

line_1: " What can to thee, a wretch like me endear!
line_2: " Say, say, for me why flows that friendly tear!

line_1: Theirs are those arts that mind to mind endear,
line_2: For honour forms the social temper here.

line_1: Thine are those charms that dazzle and endear;
line_2: Thine, Freedom, thine the blessings pictur'd here,

line_1: May ev'ry fond pleasure that moment endear;
line_2: Be banish'd afar both discretion and fear!
Why shou'd We Two continue here,
To serve and cook such homely Cheer?

line_1: Oh! form'd with all that can the heart endear,
line_2: A temper generous, and a soul sincere,
A TENDER care, that's ever near,

line_1: At once her Graces conquer and Indear.
line_2: Gentle, but awfull, as a Scene of War;

line_1: To latest time thy memory shall endear;
line_2: And in luxurious sorrow prompt the tear.

line_1: Such base, such brutal joys can ne'er endear,
line_2: Not such the hours, I hop'd, with you to share;
